alert.note: Alert for McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:49PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL TIPPAH...NORTHEASTERN BENTON...SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE... SOUTHERN HARDEMAN AND SOUTHWESTERN MCNAIRY COUNTIES... At 849 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Lagrange, or 18 miles southwest of Bolivar, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Big Hill Pond State Park, Pocahontas, Lagrange, Michigan City, Middleton, Grand Junction, Hornsby, La Grange, Hickory Valley, Saulsbury, Rogers Springs, Lisbon, Middleburg, New Canaan, Lacy, Essary Springs, Brownfield, Hebron and Pattersonville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
